body: Thanks for the report. Can you please provide the complete source of `tests.jar`? That will help us triage the problem you encountered.

Adding 3 copies of your `BarTest` class to our documentation subproject works like expected.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2319838/43688603-24c399c8-98ec-11e8-9a5e-6d701c397833.png)

Perhaps the `java -jar ...` launcher works differently? Which Java version do you use?

Found another minor issue: report entries that are published by a container context, like the `started class ...` and `finished class ...` messages above, are lacking the vertical bars. Will create a new issue for that.

@sormuras I pushed the sample project to a repository along with a README that has the repro steps and version info for my machine. From the output, I expect it is an issue with parallel test execution and the ConsoleLauncher's TreePrinterListener.

https://github.com/littleclay/junit5-issues-1524
Example of running the same command twice in a row without any changes to the files or jars, etc:

Thanks. Will look into it soon.

~~Which Java version do you use ... on your Mac?~~ Never mind. It's in the README. Thanks!

issue.title: Fixing concurrent access issue in TreePrintingListener

milestone.title: 5.3 RC1
milestone.description: *Scope:* Finishing touches on parallel test execution and output capturing, bug fixes and miscellaneous usability improvements.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
The addNode operation in the TreePrintingListener was non-atomic and
subject, therefore, to a race condition. This change makes the methods
that access the map synchronized to remove that race condition. Since
the access of the map is locked on the "this" object by the synchronized
keyword, the use of the ConcurrentHashMap is no longer needed and is
therefore an extra set of locking that is unnecessary.

Issue: #1524

## Overview

Please describe your changes here and list any open questions you might have.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [ ] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [ ] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [ ] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [ ] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/meta/API.html)
- [ ] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [ ] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body: @sormuras I was looking at the code in the TreePrintingListener and am pretty sure I spotted the issue. I made the change and built the standalone console launcher locally and tried to reproduce the bug. With the changes in place I was no longer able to reproduce the inconsistent behavior. I created a fork with the changes and pushed a pull request. This is my first code contribution and I think I got everything needed in there, but please let me know if there are any issues with it. Thanks!

@littleclay When I try to build the sample project I get the following output. Any idea what's wrong?

```
bazel build tests_deploy.jar
Unable to find any JVMs matching version "1.8".

Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it...
...............
ERROR: /Users/marc/Desktop/junit5-issues-1524/BUILD:2:1: no such package '@opentest4j//jar': Downloaded file at /private/var/tmp/_bazel_marc/989f1f7b6bb6f8eede2c4d31470673b4/external/opentest4j/org/opentest4j/opentest4j/1.1.0/opentest4j-1.1.0.jar has SHA-1 of c8e2a3e3bc7f3e4bb5075306452db5290f9b117a, does not match expected SHA-1 (6f09c598e9ff64bf0ce2fa7e7de49a99ba83c0b4) and referenced by '//:tests'
ERROR: Analysis of target '//:tests_deploy.jar' failed; build aborted: no such package '@opentest4j//jar': Downloaded file at /private/var/tmp/_bazel_marc/989f1f7b6bb6f8eede2c4d31470673b4/external/opentest4j/org/opentest4j/opentest4j/1.1.0/opentest4j-1.1.0.jar has SHA-1 of c8e2a3e3bc7f3e4bb5075306452db5290f9b117a, does not match expected SHA-1 (6f09c598e9ff64bf0ce2fa7e7de49a99ba83c0b4)
INFO: Elapsed time: 7,357s
INFO: 0 processes.
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (7 packages loaded)
```

Hmm, looks like the checksum is wrong.

Fix: https://github.com/littleclay/junit5-issues-1524/pull/2

issue.title: Make TreeNode thread-safe

milestone.title: 5.3 RC1
milestone.description: *Scope:* Finishing touches on parallel test execution and output capturing, bug fixes and miscellaneous usability improvements.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Prior to this commit, both `add` methods in `TreeNode` had race
conditions when children or report entries were added concurrently
because adding to an `ArrayList` from multiple threads is documented to
be unsafe. Now, both methods are synchronized.

Fixes #1524.
